The Practice of IxD

SVA Summer Intensive 2017

Home(work) Resources Syllabus
© 2017. All rights reserved.

Resources

Our class drive has a few things you will need. Other tools and readings that will help your process are below!

1: Read

Articles

  • David Cole — Director of Design at Quora
  • Facebook Design — collection of articles on product design
  • GV Library — advice, lessons, and tips from Google Ventures partners and entrepreneurs
  • Design Issues in 2017 — Jack Moffett’s yearly list of discussable articles

Books

  • Aarron Walter: Designing for Emotion (98 pgs)
  • Dan Saffer: Microinteractions: Designing with Details (170 pgs)
  • Don Norman: The Design of Everyday Things (Revised & Expanded Edition)
  • IDEO: The Field Guide to Human-Centered-Design
  • Louis Rosenfeld: Information Architecture for the Web and Beyond (4th Edition)

Libraries

  • Safari Books Online — get technical books on a subscription
  • Intercom — read free books from the spiking startup
2: Look

UX/UI Patterns

  • UX Archive — search by task
  • User Onboard — read teardowns of app onboarding
  • Pattern Tap — search website component examples
  • PTTRNS — search lots of mobile patterns
  • Hover States — browse more unusual selection of patterns
  • Empty States — don’t forget the null states
  • Use Your Interface — study unique ideas
  • Little Big Details — enjoy charming details
  • Codepen — join the cutting-edge community code gallery

Responsive Layouts

  • Responsive Web Design — browse lots of examples, patterns, and resources
  • Media Queries — visualize responsive layouts
  • Responsive Patterns — see and fork examples

Typography

  • Fonts In Use — browse by industry or pairing
  • Type Wolf — see trending type and get ideas for pairings

More

  • 35 of My Favorite Websites for Design Inspiration — bookmark this broad list of resources
3: Plan

Research

  • User Research Cheat Sheet — consider user-centered work for each phase
  • UX Cards — get exercises to do with your team or client
  • Inclusive Design Toolkit — browse Microsoft Design’s manual, videos, case studies, and activity cards
  • Remote Research — compare many tools and articles
  • Google Forms — make simple, clean surveys
  • Cassette — record, transcribe, and bookmark key moments in user interviews

Content

  • Tiny Content Framework — find lots of questions and outlines
  • Gather Content — keep track of who owes you what
  • Coggle — make mind maps that people actually like to look at
  • UX Wireflows kit — start mapping flows quickly and clearly
4: Find

Photos

  • Stock Photos That Don’t Suck — bookmark this big list (and read the comments for more)

Webfonts

  • Google Fonts — browse easy-to-embed open source typefaces
  • Open Foundry — enjoy a slightly more selective list

Icons

  • The Noun Project — find all kinds of icons for inspiration or use
  • Icomoon — browse icon sets or create your own
5: Design

Applications

  • IconJar — store and search all your icons
  • Stark — add a color-blind simulator and contrast checker for Sketch
  • Invision Craft — get dummy images, text, and prototypes within Sketch
  • Zeplin — export style guides from Sketch
  • Sketch Toolbox — find and keep track of plugins

Templates

  • UX Power Tools kit — start with a systematized Sketch file (get 50% off)
6: Test

Principles

  • IXD Checklist — evaluate affordances, feedback, simplicity, structure, consistency, tolerance, and accessibility

Usability

  • Usability Hub — set up recall, click, question, navigation, or preference tests
  • Verify — create preference, yes/no, click, multiclick, memory, annotation, mood, or label tests

Accessibility

  • The a11y Project — confirm you pass the recommended checklists
  • Accessible Color Palette Builder — enter hex codes and check contrast levels
7: Keep in Touch!

Meetups

  • NYC Design Systems Coalition
  • Design Driven NYC
  • Content Strategy NYC
  • Brooklyn UX

Newsletters

  • UX Design Weekly — get a thorough list of articles, tools, podcasts, and portfolios
  • Product Design Weekly — enjoy digital product design news, articles, showcases and resources
  • Design Systems Weekly — find articles and decks about pattern libraries
  • Responsive Design Weekly — skim articles, tools, tips, and tutorials
  • Unmatched Style Weekly Radar — keep up with industry stuff that looks cool
  • Sketch News — stay up-to-date on your favorite design app

(and follow/subscribe to your favorite sites above)

✌
